review_text: Great! Great! Great! Awesome course! I'm really very happy to purchase it! Thank you so much!

Regards,
Matevz

The exercises are great, they make you practice and review, and also improvise a bit if you feel like it!

Overall, brilliant course. Dan is a fantastic instructor; he has laid out the course fundamentals really well and he is pretty funny! It almost feels like you're learning with a friend. 

I did feel that some sections were a little long and drawn out, and Dan could have been a bit more concise in some of his teachings. For example, he would sometimes make errors and rectify them continuously in the middle of a video. I don't think the user needs all this extra detail; we just want to know how to use the tools.

Having said that, I will 100% be doing more of Dan's courses and I look forward to implementing my advanced Photoshop skills.

Outstanding Experience..!! 

Thank you Sir. DANIEL 
Thank you, Fiverr.com, who was able to present my service through this.

Daniel is a great instructor and made me smile so many times during the course. The course is great for understanding the scope of photoshop. There are so many features you overlook and this course helped me to get a better scope of things. Also, it's great for optimizing your workflow. The only critique I have is that the course is made by a generalist.  I couldn't find any additional insight in the areas, where's I am competent already. But I feel like that's not the point. The point is mastering Photoshop as a whole and that's what this course is great for.

Wow!!! What a tremendous course. Really, learned new thinks which are very helpful. Highly Recommend this course to everyone who is offering Adobe Photoshop related services on Fiverr.

I took this on my other account before I had you guys make me a new one with a new username. I had to deactivate the old account. But I didn't want to sit through the entire course again obviously. So I just kept pressing continue, and I started to cringe by the number of times he says "hi, guys!" in every video. I think the course is too long to warrant one badge. I would recommend splitting this into 3 courses but charging the same price. This wasn't photoshop mastery, it was photoshop essentials. There were advanced features, as well as intermediate, and beginner. I would not expect a master course to have preference settings as a chapter. One of the final quiz questions also said "this is a sample question" where the correct answer was number 3. Some of the quiz questions were not worded correctly. I would say misleading on some of them. I don't think this improved my overall knowledge.

“Hi there!” I’ve taken many courses from Dan and his Photoshop ones may be the easiest and most practical. In a short amount of time, I was able to take the Fundamentals and Mastery courses, learn Photoshop, and even make money in the real world from Photoshop jobs. Cool, huh? ;) I now feel like I can do almost anything with Photoshop, and if I can’t, I can always go back and watch the videos. Thanks for teaching me Adobe Dan!
Brilliant Teacher!!!
Really Great Tutorial.

HONEST REVIEW
• Dan always went straight to the point, explain every detail on each lesson.
• Clear english accent, you won't need subtitles (for non-native english speakers like me)
• I have learned A LOT of new tricks and shortcuts that will improve the way I work.
• With 100+ videos, this is a very extensive course.
• I would call it Advanced or Intermediate, even with 100+ videos there are more stuff, Photoshop its a huge software.
• If Dan launch another PS course, I will definitely take it, he is a great instructor and professional designer.
• I see a few comments complaining about his charisma, just relax people.

Fantaaastic Course!!! For someone like me who is an expert already and gets things done, there were still countless of small helpful skills that I've now learned!

Overall it was a great course. I really don't have many complaints other than there were maybe a few videos, where Dan didn't mention what shortcut he uses, but a simple Google search would help figure that out, so no big deal. Yes, some stuff in the course was definitely something I'll never need haha, but I still learned new valuable things. So in conclusion, I can recommend this course to anyone, who has down the basics in Photoshop and wants to get more proficient. Kind of sad there is no certificate option like in Udemy, but it still gets 5 stars from me.
